page.title: 06Village Life of the Past
page.content: The earliest record of leisure activity is the{Annual Fair}which was established in{l234,}during Henry VIII's reign. The Fair finally petered out by the middle of the l8OO's and was reintroduced after World War I only to fade away again. The weekly market, established in l234 also became a livestock event but ceased in l792. The squires were devoted to hunting, fishing and shooting. Part of the Lord of the Manor's estate was run almost to the exclusion of anything other than the furtherance and pursuit of sport.{Hambledon Hunt}occasionally held their annual meeting at the Golden Lion. 'Club Day' was probably a May Day celebration, with church in the morning and tea was in the Golden Lion. It was a day of celebration.
